When selection mode is on, input to the world view will modify the current selection.  When selection mode is off, input will modify the active layer based on the current brush.

EDSTR_TIP_032=The Unit data type represents any object in the game world which can affect gameplay, including mobile units, buildings, missiles, destructible objects, and pathing blockers. /// The Unit data type represents any object in the game world which can affect gameplay, including mobile units, buildings, missiles, destructible objects, and pathing blockers.
EDSTR_TIP_033=The Actor data type represents any visual object or effect in the game world, and are generally associated with Units or Effects. /// The Actor data type represents any visual object or effect in the game world, and are generally associated with Units or Effects.
EDSTR_TIP_034=The Ability data type represents actions which can be performed by Units, usually through buttons on the command card. /// The Ability data type represents actions which can be performed by Units, usually through buttons on the command card.
EDSTR_TIP_035=The Weapon data type represents types of attacks performed by Units. /// The Weapon data type represents types of attacks performed by Units.
EDSTR_TIP_036=The Behavior data type represents passive effects or states that may be applied to Units. /// The Behavior data type represents passive effects or states that may be applied to Units.
